prompts.spam_detection:
Analyze this GitHub Issue/PR for spam content:

Title: {title}
Body: {body}
Template: {template_analysis}
{file_changes}

Is this spam or meaningless content?
Spam indicators:
- Random characters or keyboard mashing (e.g., 'asdfghjkl', 'qwerty123')
- Advertisement or promotional content
- Malicious links or content
- Completely unrelated to the project
- Obvious test submissions with no purpose
- Repeated identical content
- Content in languages completely unrelated to project context

Note: For Issues, file_changes will be empty. For PRs, it shows actual code changes.

Respond ONLY with:
- `SPAM` - if spam or meaningless content
- `NOT_SPAM` - if legitimate content (even if low quality)
prompts.pr_commit_check:
Analyze this GitHub PR commit title compliance:

Title: {pr_title}

Does this title follow standard Git commit conventions or is it descriptive enough?
Good examples: 'feat: add new feature', 'fix: resolve bug', 'docs: update readme', 'Update README.md', 'Add login functionality', 'Fix authentication issue'
Bad examples: random text, single meaningless words, non-descriptive titles like 'test', 'update', 'fix'

Respond ONLY with:
- `VALID` - if follows conventions or is descriptive
- `INVALID` - if meaningless or completely non-descriptive
prompts.issue_classification:
Classify this GitHub Issue based on its content:

Title: {issue_title}
Content: {user_content}

Available labels: {labels_options}

Analyze the issue type:
- BUG: Error reports, unexpected behavior, crashes
- ENHANCEMENT/FEATURE: New feature requests, improvements
- QUESTION: Help requests, usage questions, clarifications
- DOCUMENTATION: Issues about docs, README, guides
- Other labels as provided

Respond with ONLY the label name (e.g., BUG, ENHANCEMENT, QUESTION).
prompts.unclear_issue_smart_answer:
Provide a brief, helpful answer for this unclear GitHub Issue based strictly on README content.

README Content: {readme_content}

Issue Title: {issue_title}
Issue Body: {issue_body}

Requirements:
- Only answer if README contains directly relevant information.
- Answer must be concise (1-2 sentences, max 80 Chinese characters).
- Base answer strictly on specific README content, do not fabricate.
- If no relevant content, respond with NEED_MORE_INFO.
- Respond in Chinese.

Response format:
- If relevant info found: HELPFUL_ANSWER: + brief Chinese answer
- If no relevant info: NEED_MORE_INFO
